Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Hmm, this is a detailed pseudo-BPMN process for a smartphone supply chain. The user wants 20 open-ended questions exploring rationale, improvements, risks, decisions, communication, and performance.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: I should structure the questions to cover all key aspects: strategic decisions in the process design, risk management across the chain, performance metrics, stakeholder coordination, and adaptability. The questions need to be thought-provoking without being too narrow.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For strategic rationale, I can ask about component sourcing choices and parallel flows. For risks, questions about single points of failure and geopolitical factors make sense. Performance questions should balance efficiency and resilience. Stakeholder questions should address communication challenges. Finally, adaptability questions should explore triggers and feedback loops.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: The questions should avoid yes/no answers and instead prompt deeper analysis of trade-offs and underlying assumptions in the process design.
